destinations.Activities: take a photo with AboElhol(spinx) and with the pyramids take your breakfast at a site of pyramits
destinations.Attractions: see the three famous pyramit (Khufu, khafre, Menkaure)
destinations.Includes: Tour guide, Air-conditioned vehicle, Entry tickets
destinations.description: The Giza Pyramid Complex is one of the most iconic archaeological sites in the world and a timeless symbol of ancient Egyptian civilization. Home to the Great Pyramid of Khufu—one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World—it stands as a remarkable achievement of engineering, architecture, and human ambition.  Located on the Giza Plateau near Cairo, the site includes the pyramids of Khufu, Khafre, and Menkaure, along with the Great Sphinx, creating a unique historical landscape that has fascinated travelers for centuries. Visitors can explore the monumental structures, learn about ancient burial rituals, and experience the mysteries surrounding their construction.  Today, the Giza Pyramids remain a must-visit destination for tourists from around the globe, offering an unforgettable journey into Egypt’s rich history, culture, and enduring legacy.
destinations.name: Giza Pyramids
destinations.shortDescription: One of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and a world-famous archaeological site

destinations.Activities: Guided historical tours with Egyptologists  Walking through the Great Hypostyle Hall and exploring its massive columns  Visiting the Sacred Lake and learning about ancient rituals  Exploring the Avenue of Sphinxes connecting Karnak to Luxor Temple  Attending the Sound and Light Show at night  Photography of monumental architecture and detailed hieroglyphs  Exploring open courtyards, pylons, and chapels of different pharaohs  Learning about ancient Egyptian religion and temple ceremonies  Enjoying cultural and educational tours for students and researchers  Relaxing walks around the temple complex and surrounding areas
destinations.Attractions: The Great Hypostyle Hall  Temple of Amun-Ra  The Sacred Lake  The Avenue of Sphinxes  Massive pylons and monumental gateways  Colossal statues of pharaohs
destinations.BestTimeToVisit: October to April: Best overall time, with mild and comfortable weather
destinations.description: The Karnak Temple Complex is the largest religious complex in ancient Egypt and one of the most impressive sacred sites ever built. Dedicated primarily to the god Amun-Ra, it features vast courtyards, towering pylons, massive columns, and colossal statues that reflect the power and devotion of ancient Egyptian civilization.  Located in Luxor, Karnak was developed over more than two thousand years by successive pharaohs, making it a living record of Egypt’s religious and political history. The Great Hypostyle Hall, with its enormous stone columns, is one of the most breathtaking architectural achievements in the ancient world.  Today, the Karnak Temple Complex is a major tourist attraction, offering visitors a powerful insight into ancient Egyptian beliefs, monumental architecture, and the grandeur of a civilization that shaped human history.
destinations.name: Karnak Temple
destinations.shortDescription: The largest religious complex in ancient Egypt with massive columns and statues

destinations.Activities: Snorkeling and scuba diving in coral reefs  Glass-bottom boat trips  Desert safari (quad biking & camel rides)  Boat cruises to Tiran Island  Parasailing and water sports  Shopping and dining at Naama Bay  Nightlife and entertainment shows
destinations.Attractions: Ras Mohammed National Park  Naama Bay  SOHO Square  Sharks Bay  Tiran Island  Old Market (Sharm El Maya)  Farsha Café (cliffside views)
destinations.BestTimeToVisit: March–May & September–November: Perfect balance for beaches and diving
destinations.Includes: Airport pick-up and drop-off  Accommodation in a 4★ or 5★ seaside resort  Daily breakfast (all-inclusive option available)  Guided city tour of Sharm El Sheikh  Snorkeling or diving trip in the Red Sea  Visit to Ras Mohammed National Park  Boat trip to Tiran Island  Desert safari experience (quad bike & camel ride)  Transportation for all scheduled tours  Professional tour guide  All taxes and service charges included
destinations.description: Sharm El Sheikh is a famous tourist city known for its world-class resorts, stunning beaches, and exceptional diving spots. Located on the Red Sea, it offers crystal-clear waters, colorful coral reefs, and rich marine life, making it a top destination for snorkeling and scuba diving enthusiasts.  The city combines natural beauty with modern amenities, featuring luxury hotels, vibrant nightlife, and relaxing seaside experiences. Popular areas such as Naama Bay and Ras Mohammed National Park attract visitors from around the world.  Sharm El Sheikh is an ideal destination for leisure, adventure, and relaxation, offering a perfect blend of sun, sea, and unforgettable Red Sea experiences.
destinations.name: sharm El sheikh
destinations.shortDescription: A famous tourist city known for resorts, beaches, and diving spots.

destinations.Activities: Guided temple visits with a professional Egyptologist  Leisure sailing with Nile panoramic views  Onboard cultural shows (Galabeya night, folklore)  Sun deck relaxation and swimming pool  Traditional Egyptian cuisine on board  Evening entertainment and music
destinations.Attractions: Karnak Temple & Luxor Temple  Valley of the Kings  Temple of Hatshepsut  Edfu Temple  Kom Ombo Temple  Philae Temple  Aswan High Dam
destinations.BestTimeToVisit: October to April: Best overall time, with mild and comfortable weather
destinations.description: Experience the beauty of Egypt while cruising along the Nile River, where history and natural scenery come together in a unique journey. A Nile cruise offers breathtaking views of lush riverbanks, traditional villages, and timeless landscapes that have inspired civilizations for thousands of years.  As you sail between Luxor and Aswan, you can visit some of Egypt’s most famous temples and monuments, including Karnak, Luxor Temple, Edfu, and Philae. The cruise combines comfort and luxury with guided cultural experiences, providing deep insight into ancient Egyptian heritage.  A Nile River cruise is one of the most memorable ways to explore Egypt, blending relaxation, culture, and history into an unforgettable travel experience.
destinations.name: Nile River Cuise
destinations.shortDescription: Experience the beauty of Egypt while cruising along the Nile River.

destinations.description: A remote desert oasis offering a rare blend of natural beauty, deep-rooted traditions, and rich history. Known for its distinctive local culture, the oasis is home to indigenous communities who preserve ancient customs, architecture, and language. Surrounded by vast sand dunes and dramatic landscapes, it features crystal-clear natural springs, palm groves, and fertile farmlands that have sustained life for thousands of years. Scattered across the area are ancient ruins, old fortresses, and temples that reflect the oasis’s strategic and cultural importance throughout different historical periods. Visiting this oasis provides a peaceful and authentic experience, allowing travelers to explore untouched nature, discover archaeological treasures, and connect with a way of life that has remained largely unchanged over centuries.
destinations.name: Siwa Oasis
destinations.shortDescription: A remote oasis known for its unique culture, natural springs, and ancient ruins.

destinations.description: The famous rock temples built by Pharaoh Ramses II stand as one of the greatest engineering and artistic achievements of ancient Egypt. Carved directly into a sandstone cliff during the 13th century BCE, these monumental temples were constructed to honor Ramses II and the gods Amun-Ra, Ra-Horakhty, Ptah, and the deified Ramses himself. The main temple is renowned for its four colossal seated statues of Ramses II guarding the entrance, symbolizing royal power, divine authority, and Egypt’s dominance during the New Kingdom.  Originally located at Abu Simbel in southern Egypt, the temples faced a major threat in the 1960s with the construction of the Aswan High Dam, which would have submerged them under the rising waters of Lake Nasser. In an extraordinary international effort led by UNESCO, the temples were carefully dismantled block by block, each weighing several tons, and relocated to higher ground nearby. The relocation preserved not only the structures but also their precise orientation, ensuring the famous solar alignment phenomenon—where sunlight illuminates the inner sanctuary statues twice a year—remained intact.  Today, the Abu Simbel temples are a powerful symbol of ancient Egyptian ingenuity and modern engineering collaboration. They attract visitors from around the world who come to admire their monumental scale, detailed reliefs depicting military victories and religious scenes, and the remarkable story of their rescue. The temples offer a profound insight into the legacy of Ramses II and the determination to protect humanity’s shared cultural heritage.
destinations.name: Abu Simbel Temples
destinations.shortDescription: Famous rock temples built by Ramses II, relocated to avoid flooding from the Aswan High Dam.

destinations.description: Alexandria is a historic coastal city that blends ancient heritage with a vibrant modern atmosphere. It is best known as the home of the legendary Library of Alexandria, once the greatest center of learning in the ancient world, attracting scholars, scientists, and philosophers from across the Mediterranean. Although the original library was lost, its legacy lives on in the modern Bibliotheca Alexandrina, a striking cultural landmark that celebrates knowledge, research, and global dialogue.  Set along the Mediterranean Sea, Alexandria is also famous for its beautiful beaches, scenic corniche, and refreshing sea breeze. The city’s coastline offers a mix of sandy beaches, seaside cafés, and panoramic views, making it a popular destination for relaxation and leisure. Combined with its Greco-Roman ruins, historic forts like Qaitbay Citadel, and rich cultural life, Alexandria provides visitors with a unique experience where history, culture, and the Mediterranean lifestyle come together.
destinations.name: Alexandria trip
destinations.shortDescription: Home to the historic Library of Alexandria and beautiful Mediterranean beaches.

destinations.description: A laid-back coastal town celebrated for its crystal-clear waters, vibrant coral reefs, and world-class diving sites. Known for its relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, the town attracts travelers seeking both adventure and tranquility. Its dive spots offer rich marine life, colorful coral gardens, and excellent visibility, making it a favorite destination for scuba divers and snorkelers of all levels.  Beyond the sea, the town features a charming mix of beachfront cafés, small resorts, and local markets, creating an easygoing lifestyle that encourages visitors to slow down and enjoy the surroundings. Whether exploring underwater wonders, relaxing on sandy beaches, or watching the sunset over the water, this beach town offers a perfect balance of natural beauty and peaceful escape.
destinations.name: Dahab
destinations.shortDescription: A laid-back beach town known for its diving spots and relaxed atmosphere

destinations.description: An ancient temple complex located on the east bank of the Nile River, renowned as one of the most significant religious centers of ancient Egypt. The site is characterized by its vast scale, monumental gateways, towering columns, and richly carved walls covered with hieroglyphs and sacred scenes. Over centuries, successive pharaohs expanded and enhanced the complex, transforming it into a powerful symbol of religious devotion and royal authority.  Dedicated primarily to the worship of major deities, the temple complex played a central role in religious festivals, rituals, and state ceremonies. Its location along the Nile made it easily accessible for processions and pilgrims, reinforcing its importance in both spiritual and political life. Today, the complex stands as an extraordinary testament to ancient Egyptian architecture, engineering, and belief systems, offering visitors a deep and immersive journey into Egypt’s ancient past.
destinations.name: Luxor temple
destinations.shortDescription: An ancient temple complex located on the east bank of the Nile River.
